Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ORDER FOR BAIL FORFEITURE /s/PB
Order for Bail Forfeiture
Motion for Bail Forfeiture. Filed by Prosecutor.
/s/ RJS 01/18/22 (e-mail to DA Warrants on 01/19/22 in re:  warrant/minutes available sp)
Body Only - sent to Br 2 Judge on 01/18/22 sp

01:43 PM Defendant Onecimo Lopez Arcos not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
ADA Cassidy is requesting a warrant - body only.
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Cassidy would request forfeiture of the $10,000 cash bond.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant - body only
Bond will not be forfeited
Confirmation of Interpreter
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

No contact with minors under the age of 18 years, unless supervised by an adult.
No contact with the alleged victim P.D., the victim's mother, P.M., their family, or their property at the address stated on record.
Contact includes that which is digital, mail, or voice either by the defendant personally, or by a third party.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge appears in court. Interpreter Enrique Soria appears by video. Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Interpreter is sworn in by the clerk.
Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of:
Causing a child under the age of 13 to view or listen to sexual activity, 
Exposing a child to harmful material, 
Exposing genitals, pubic area, or intimate parts to a child, 
Child enticement (multiple counts), 
and 1st degree sexual assault of a child. 

Atty Renc states the defendant is not eligible for representation by the public defender.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $30,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc makes bond arguments and requests a cash bond of $1000.00.

Initial Appearance scheduled for: January 18th @ 1:15 p.m. in Branch 2.

BY THE COURT:
$10,000 cash bond.
No contact with minors under the age of 18 years, unless supervised by an adult.
No contact with the alleged victim P.D., the victim's mother, P.M., their family, or their property at the address stated on record.
Contact includes that which is digital, mail, or voice either by the defendant personally, or by a third party.

Atty Renc requests that the state provide initials for the victim and their family. 
Atty Dodge makes statements.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc appears in court for defendant. 

Atty Renc indicates the defendant will need an interpreter. 
Court questions the defendant if he understands english. 
Defendant states no. 

Court adjourns to 12/28 at 1:00 for an interpreter to be present.
